data.title: Jim Allen's First Book "Smoken Mirrors - a Twentieth and Twenty-first Century Chronicle of Cover-up and Conspiracy" a Unique Work Full of Thoughtful Meditations
data.meta_description: New book "Smoken Mirrors - A Twentieth and Twenty-First Century Chronicle of Cover-Up and Conspiracy" is a powerful journey through the thoughts and words of a prolific poet shining a new light on some old theories.
data.text:
Jim Allen, a writer and racing-sports enthusiast, has completed his first book “Smoken Mirrors – A Twentieth and Twenty-First Century Chronicle of Cover-Up and Conspiracy”: a gripping and potent expose chronicling some of the major world events that have been historically questioned as to their accuracy. Jim Allen has recently appeared on many talk shows including Caravan to Midnight with John B. Wells. He will continue his voyage to appear on other talk shows across the United States.

Published by New York City-based Page Publishing, Jim Allen’s poignant tale sheds a new and more detailed light on conspiracies from UFOs to the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. It is the story of one man's search for truth amidst enshrouding darkness.

In this book, author Jim Allen takes readers on a wild ride through some of the greatest tragedies in American History. With the evidence and logic provided, the reader can come to their own conclusions as to which events exhibit cover-up and conspiracy. This book demonstrates that information the general public receives through media sources is often biased and manipulated in content from higher sources. It’s a fast, easy read and will probably have a profound psychological effect on the reader. It will leave readers with an imprint that “nothing is as it appears, it’s all – Smoken Mirrors!”

Readers who wish to experience this gripping work can purchase “Smoken Mirrors – A Twentieth and Twenty-First Century Chronicle of Cover-Up and Conspiracy” at bookstores everywhere, or online at the Apple iTunes store, Amazon, Google Play or Barnes and Noble.

For additional information or media inquiries, contact Page Publishing at 866-315-2708.
